snippet: Republican candidates who benefited from the Tea Party in 2010, but lost two years later, hope to rebound next year by focusing on the health care law.
abstract: Former congressman Bob Dold of Illinois is one of at least nine Republican candidates who benefited from the Tea Party in 2010, lost power two years later, and now hopes to rebound by focusing on public antipathy to the Affordable Care Act; new focus could indicate change in some corners of the party, as former firebrands mellow their messages in an attempt to capitalize on the political center.
lead_paragraph: Republican candidates who benefited from the Tea Party in 2010, but lost two years later, hope to rebound next year by focusing on the health care law.

headline.main: G.O.P. Firebrands Tone Down Their Message and Run Again
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Firebrands Tone Down Their Message and Run Again

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
